title: Multidimensional Interactive Fixed-Effects. (arXiv:2209.11691v2 [econ.EM] UPDATED)
abstract: This paper studies a linear and additively separable model for multidimensional panel data of three or more dimensions with unobserved interactive fixed effects. Two approaches are considered to account for these unobserved interactive fixed-effects when estimating coefficients on the observed covariates. First, the model is embedded within the standard two-dimensional panel framework and restrictions are derived under which the factor structure methods in Bai (2009) lead to consistent estimation of model parameters, but at potentially slow rates of convergence. The second approach utilises popular machine learning techniques to develop group fixed-effects and kernel weighted fixed-effects that are more robust to the multidimensional nature of the problem and can achieve the parametric rate of consistency under certain conditions. Theoretical results and simulations show the benefit of standard two-dimensional panel methods when the structure of the interactive fixed-effect term is kno

ret.translated_abstract: 本文研究一种针对三个或更多维度具有未观察到的交互固定效应的多维面板数据的线性可加模型。在估计观察到的协变量上的系数时，考虑了两种方法来解释这些未观察到的交互固定效应。首先，将该模型嵌入到标准的二维面板框架中，并得出在此约束条件下，Bai（2009）中的因子结构方法导致一致估计模型参数的收敛速度可能很慢。第二种方法利用流行的机器学习技术来开发组固定效应和核加权固定效应，这些方法更能适应问题的多维本质，并可以在一定条件下实现参数一致性。理论结果和模拟表明，当交互固定效应项的结构已知时，标准的二维面板方法具有优势。
ret.tldr: 本文研究了一个针对多维面板数据的线性可加模型，提出了两种方法来解释未观察到的交互固定效应，在模型结构已知的情况下标准的二维面板方法具有优势。
